sectionText: In this course, students will examine and learn advertising principles and practices related to ?place brands." The class will develop knowledge and skills related to how "place brands" use food, media, locations, people, history, businesses and culture to tell their brand stories and create brand identities in the context of a global marketplace. It will also allow students to develop critical international insight and build global perspectives.  The course includes travel to London and Rome for 14 days in May. Students must apply for and be accepted to the course.   Registration requires permission of instructor. Applications available at http://studyabroad.illinois.edu.
